text:
<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Call Failures>
We are investigating call failures and issues accessing Amazon Connect in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Call Failures>
We are investigating call failures and issues accessing Amazon Connect in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service degradation: Increased Call Failures>
Call handling has recovered for agents who can access Amazon Connect in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to investigate problems accessing the Amazon Connect Console.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Call Failures>
Between 10:02 AM and 11:13 AM PDT, some Amazon Connect users experienced issues logging in or performing actions in the Connect application in the US-EAST-1 Region. Some calls may have failed during this time. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Error Rates and Latencies>
We are investigating increased API error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates and Latencies>
We are investigating increased API error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates and Latencies>
Between 6:00 PM and 6:41 PM PDT we experienced increased API error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
